text.content: ********** NEW Update ********** C’mie, the lost dog from Padang Merbok / Bukit Tunku is now available for adoption.
My family and I have been nurturing her back to good health and training her with basic command.
Unfortunately we are unable to foster her for an extended duration of time because of our working culture.
She has the potential to be a worthy dog, as such I am looking for the best option for her.
This shall be a process for adoption, as a friendly reminder, this is NOT a process of buying-selling.
Whereby, a second visit shall be considered as conclusive that both of the adopter’s and c’mie criteria fits each other.
By the end of this week .. the decision for the adoption will be made.
I’m pleased to answer further questions regarding her characteristics and behaviour.
As a general overview, she is an energetic, adventurous and fast-learning puppy.
At time she is stubborn, vocal (She now has better control of excitement, she is not aggressive) and pleads with you thru the trick of the trade for being a puppy.
She behaves well when you are grooming her, if she behaves otherwise, all she needs is time to relax beforehand.
She requires a compound and daily walks.
Preferably she is adopted by a family with basic knowledge of caring for a dog, a family with children and a family that is inclined for outdoor activities.
She would require training to be an obedient dog as she possesses the traits of a dominant dog.
Above all else, she reacts best with positive reinforcement.
She is more likely to grow bigger but not taller.
Her best features is her paws, it is strong and sturdy.

Adoption fees RM includes Hills prescription diet I/D (More or less sufficient for July), Ear Drops, Ears Cleaning Fluid, Dog Bowl, Collar (She was found with this collar, would require a bigger collar when she grows bigger) and leash and Dog Bowl.
If the adopter does not have a dog cage, I’m willing to provide mine for RM, as it is intended to be donated to the ASPCA.
********** End of Update ********** A puppy with RED collar was found at Padang Merbok.
She was wandering about until my group of friends decided to play with her.
During the drive to SPCA, it is apparent that she has experience being in the car.
SPCA has placed her under the waiting list for adoption.
A trip to the vet has confirmed that she has has negative result in both distemper and parvo cvirus.
However, she does have an extended stomach as she has not been eating well.
Within 2 weeks of regular feeding, it would allow her to return to good health.
A treatable physical ailment is that she does have ear mites.
Her ears are now cleaned daily coupled with the administration of ear drops.
Now that she feels at comfort, it is apparent that she is an intelligent dog that would requires obedience and discipline.
She is potentially a good guard dog, respective to the general traits of a German Shepard Dog.
She DOES know that there are certain things that would get her into trouble.
She will proceed with guilty eyes and plead vocally with you.
She chooses to relief herself outdoors, groom herself post-walk.
As of yet, there are no listing found for her.
Her owner is still being sought after.
Due to the extensive working hours during the weekday and marathon training during the weekend, I am unable to foster her for an extended period of time.
She would be well suited for an active lifestyle.
